title: Gerhard Schröder - Wikipedia
snippet: Gerhard Fritz Kurt Schröder (German: [ˈɡeːɐ̯haʁt fʁɪts kʊʁt ˈʃʁøːdɐ] ⓘ; born 7 April 1944) is a German former politician and lobbyist who served as Chancellor of Germany from 1998 to 2005. From 1999 to 2004, he was also the Leader of the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD).

title: Gerhard Schröder | German Chancellor, Social Democrat | Britannica
snippet: Gerhard Schröder is a German politician who was the chancellor of Germany from 1998 to 2005. Having practiced law in Hannover, Schröder was elected to the Bundestag (lower house of parliament) in 1980 and served there until 1986, when he lost ...

title: Gerhard Schröder - New World Encyclopedia
snippet: Schröder in Esslingen. "SPD - Trust in Germany" Gerhard Fritz Kurt Schröder (born April 7, 1944), German politician, was Chancellor of Germany from 1998 to 2005. A member of the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD), he led a coalition government of the SPD and the Greens.

title: Gerhard Schröder
snippet: Gerhard Schröder, born in Mossenberg (North Rhine-Westfalia) on 7 April 1944, is a former Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany. He studied at University of Göttingen where he graduated in Law with post-graduate Judicial Clerkship ...

title: Gerhard Schröder - Geschichte der CDU - Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung
snippet: Gerhard Schröder wurde am 11. September 1910 als Sohn eines ostfriesischen Reichsbahnbeamten in Saarbrücken geboren. Nach der Versetzung seines Vaters wuchs er in Trier auf.
